DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To test feasibility hypnosis pre-operative intervention reduction surgical- anesthesia-related symptom woman undergo lumpectomy sentinel node biopsy , mastectomy , mastectomy lymph node dissection locally recurrent breast cancer . - To identify physical symptom ( i.e. , pain , nausea , vomit ) psychological symptom ( i.e. , anxiety distress ) patient undergoing hypnosis . - To determine length stay Post Anesthesia Care Unit patient undergo adjunct hypnosis . - To describe patient satisfaction hypnosis experience . - To determine effect size calculate sample need randomized clinical trial use result study . OUTLINE : Patients undergo script hypnotic intervention 15 minute within 1 hour prior plan surgical procedure . Upon completion intervention , patient proceed Preoperative Holding Area Surgery Post Anesthesia Care Unit receive standard care lumpectomy sentinel node biopsy , mastectomy , mastectomy lymph node dissection . Patients undergo collection demographic information ( i.e. , age ; gender ; ethnicity ; marital/partnered status ; spiritual practice ; family member home ; stress management history ; experience continuum imagery/hypnosis practice ; perception concentration ability ; favorite aroma , color , scene nature ) time consent use Demographic Survey Questionnaire . They also undergo assessment physical psychological symptom ( i.e. , pain , nausea , vomiting , anxiety , generalized distress ) baseline ( immediately prior hypnotic induction ) intervention ( prior discharge Post Anesthesia Care Unit ) .
